intro: Gustavia valida, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, showy white flowers with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture. Gustavia valida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
